item.title: Project Euler 28: Number Spiral Diagonals
item.description: Problem Statement Starting with the number 1 and moving to the right in a clockwise direction, a 5-by-5 spiral is formed: Figure 1: A 5-by-5 number spiral. The diagonal entries are bolded. It can be verified that the sum of the numbers on the diagonals is 101. What is the sum of the numbers on the diagonals in an \(N \times N\) spiral (\(N\) odd)? Report your answer modulo \(10^9 + 7\).
